events.label: Sep 19, 2025
events.note: The House passes a short-term Continuing Resolution (CR). The Senate does not advance the measure amid disagreements over spending priorities (as of Oct 2025).

events.label: Sep 30, 2025
events.note: The Senate does not advance competing funding proposals; a lapse in funding occurs at 12:01 a.m. EDT on Oct 1 (as of Oct 2025).

events.label: Oct 1, 2025
events.note: Federal funding expires at 12:01 a.m. EDT, triggering a partial government shutdown. Essential services continue; many employees are furloughed or working with pay delayed (as of Oct 2025).
events.cost: See economic_loss banner for growth impact estimate (as of Oct 2025).

events.label: Oct 1, 2025
events.note: Senate leaders discuss options for shorter-term funding; no agreement announced (as of Oct 2025).

events.label: Oct 1, 2025
events.note: Markets fluctuate as participants assess potential impacts; some haven assets rise while risk assets vary (as of Oct 2025).

events.label: Oct 1, 2025
events.note: Senate leaders discuss options for shorter-term funding; no agreement announced (as of Oct 2025).

events.label: Oct 2, 2025
events.note: The Senate does not pass funding legislation; the partial shutdown continues (as of Oct 2025).

events.label: Oct 2, 2025
events.note: The Department of Education reviews concerns regarding modified automated out-of-office messages (as of Oct 2025).

events.label: Oct 3, 2025
events.note: The House remains in recess while negotiations continue (as of Oct 2025).

events.label: Oct 5, 2025
events.note: Day 5 of the shutdown; limited operations continue where authorized (as of Oct 2025).

events.label: Oct 6, 2025
events.note: The Senate does not advance a stopgap funding bill requiring 60 votes; the White House calls for a bipartisan agreement (as of Oct 2025).
